title: Clusterpath for Hüsler-Reiss
text: HRClusterpath R-package provides tools variable clustering Husler-Reiss models, specially using graphical models structure.

title: Clusterpath for Hüsler-Reiss
text: install package, one can write R-terminal :

title: Clusterpath for Hüsler-Reiss
text: section gives overview package’s tools.

title: Clusterpath for Hüsler-Reiss
text: first method can use package hierarchical clustering (variables) using Clusterpath algorithm applied likelihood precision matrix Husler Reiss graphical model fused-Lasso penalty. can use : get_cluster get optimal cluster fixed parameter \(\lambda\) estimated variogram \(\hat \Gamma\) customizable weights. HR_Clusterpath build list optimal results grid \(\lambda\) standards exponnential weights. gg_cluster provides dendrogram induced results HR_Clusterpath function. others functions analyze results.

title: ChiToGamma — ChiToGamma
text: Transform \(\chi\) matrix corresponding variogram \(\Gamma\)

title: ChiToGamma — ChiToGamma
ChiToGamma — ChiToGamma
text: Chi_matrix matrix \(\chi_{ij}\) entries.

title: ChiToGamma — ChiToGamma
text: Gives variogram \(\Gamma\) according \(\chi\) matrix Hüsler-Reiss MGDP. case, exists closed equation link variogram extremal coefficients, given : $$    \chi_{ij} = 2 - 2 \phi(\sqrt{\Gamma_{ij}/2}) $$ \(\phi\) standard normal distribution function.

title: Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
text: Visual representation distance evolution clusters along \(\lambda\). recall precision matrix \(\Theta\) block matrix structure, distance two variables defined : $$   D(\Theta_{\cdot}, \Theta_{j\cdot}) = \sqrt{\sum_{k\neq ,j} (\Theta_{ik} - \Theta_{jk})^2}, $$ distance, two variables cluster null distance.

title: Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
text: list_results list results optimization HR_Clusterpath(). names list name : names variables, NULL \(1,...,d\).

title: Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
text: cluster's distance measure dissimilarities variable. mind, dissimilarities matrix \(W\) want build \(\lambda\) reconstition 1-dimensional scatter plot respect dissimilarities. use function cmdscale() stats package operate optimization. follows analysis \([1]\).

title: Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
text: \([1]\) properties clasical multi-dimesional scaling K.V. Mardia

title: Multidimensional scaling for Clusterpath. — ggdistance
code: # Construction of clusters and R matrix R <- matrix(c(1, -3, 0,               -3, 2, -2,               0, -2, 1), nc = 3) clusters <- list(1:5, 6:10, 11:15)  # Construction of induced theta and corresponding variogram gamma Theta <- build_Theta(R, clusters) Gamma <- graphicalExtremes::Theta2Gamma(Theta)  gr3_bal_sim_param_cluster <-   list(     R = R,     clusters = clusters,     Theta = Theta,     Gamma = Gamma,     chi = 1,     n = 1e3,     d = 15   )  set.seed(804) data <- graphicalExtremes::rmpareto(n = gr3_bal_sim_param_cluster$n,                                     model = "HR",                                     par = gr3_bal_sim_param_cluster$Gamma)  lambda <- seq(0, 2, 1e-3)

title: Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
text: refit procedure based convex optimization problem solved CVXR package. Based results produced HR_Clusterpath, new problem defined minimization negative loglikelihood Hüsler-Reiss model precision matrix \(\Theta\) constraints block matrix structure induced estimated clusters. solutions computed value \(\lambda\) output HR_Clusterpath.

title: Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
text: hrc_output object HR_Clusterpath function.

title: Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
text: object class HR_Clusterpath_refit structure HR_Clusterpath output refitted R matrices result.

title: Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
text: problem solution provided HR_clusterpath may biased due penalty negative loglikelihood. avoid potential issue, matrix \(R\) refitted solution \(\lambda\) non-penalized negative loglikelihood constraining estimated clusters.

title: Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath refitted — hr-clusterpath-refit
code: # Initialization of the parameters for the simulation R <- matrix(c(1, -3, 0,               -3, 2, -2,               0, -2, 1), nc = 3) clusters <- list(1:5, 6:10, 11:15)  # Building of the variogram matrix for the simulation Theta <- build_Theta(R, clusters) Gamma <- graphicalExtremes::Theta2Gamma(Theta)  # Simulation of data set.seed(123) n <- 1e4 d <- ncol(Gamma) data <- graphicalExtremes::rmstable(            n = n,            model = "HR",            d = d,            par = Gamma)  # Computation of the multivariate Pareto data norm_inf <- apply(abs(data), 1, max) quantile <- sort(norm_inf, decreasing = TRUE) |> as.numeric() k <- floor(0.1 * nrow(data)) u <- quantile[k]  data_par <- data[norm_inf > u, ] / u         # Multivariate Pareto data  # Computation of the Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath zeta <- log(n) ** 2              # Zeta parameter for the exponential weights HRC <- HR_Clusterpath(data_par, lambda = 10, zeta = zeta)  # First estimation of R HRC$results$l1$R #>             [,1]      [,2]        [,3] #> [1,]  1.18671702 -3.153842 -0.09860223 #> [2,] -3.15384155  1.824990 -1.85374153 #> [3,] -0.09860223 -1.853742  0.90719632  # Refit of the Hüsler-Reiss Clusterpath HRC_refit <- HR_Clusterpath_refit(HRC)  # New estimation of R HRC_refit$results$l1$R #>            [,1]      [,2]       [,3] #> [1,]  1.0695803 -3.002448 -0.1067049 #> [2,] -3.0024481  1.562946 -1.8063244 #> [3,] -0.1067049 -1.806324  0.8696769

what: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
text: Block gradient descent based Clusterpath algorithm Hüsler-Reiss graphical model. Usefull precision matrix \(\Theta\) (variogram \(\Gamma\)) block matrix structure.

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
code: HR_Clusterpath(   data,   lambda,   zeta,   W = NULL,   p = NULL,   eps_f = NULL,   kappa = 0.01,   eps_conv = 1e-07,   tol_opt = 0.001,   iter_max = 1000 )

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
text: data \(n \times d\) matrix : matrix data. lambda positive number, regularized parameter penalty. numerix vector positive number : grid line \(\lambda\). zeta positive number : tuned parameter exponential weights. W NULL, parameter used. W \(d \times d\) matrix positive number : weights penalty. NULL (default), set exponential weights, depends one tuning parameter \(\zeta\) theoretical results. p numeric 0 1, NULL.  NULL (default), assumed data already multivariate Pareto scale. Else, p used probability function data2mpareto() standardize data (see graphicalExtremes documentation). eps_f positive number : tolerance threshold merging clusters. NULL (default), set \(\kappa\) times median non-diagonal elements distance matrix column initial \(\Theta\). kappa positive number : tuned parameter fusion threshold. eps_f NULL, parameter used. eps_conv positive number : tolerance threshold convergence algorithm. tol_opt positive number : tolerance optimal step gradient descent. iter_max integer : maximal number iterations procedure.

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
text: HR_Clusterpath() block gradient descent data default values method optimization : variogram matrix \(\Gamma\) empirical variogram weights set exponential weights, depends one tuning parameter \(\zeta\) theoretical guarantees provided. output object class HR_Clusterpath contains list several datas : $results : list results value lambda, result list following elements : $R \(R\) matrix clusters, $clusters list variable indices separated per cluster, $likelihood value penalised negative loglikelihood $lambda corresponding regularized parameter. $Gamma : variogram matrix used procedure. $inputs : list input parameters used procedure.

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
text: block matrix models characterized two objects : clustering partition \(\{C_1, \dots, C_K\}\) \(V = \{1, \dots, d\}\) matrix \(R\) belongs \(\mathcal S_K(\mathbb R)\), set symmetric \(K \times K\) matrix (See also build_theta() extract_R_matrix()). Clusterpath aims find optimum penalised negative loglikelihood defined neg_likelihood_pen().

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath
text: get replications \(X_1, \dots, X_n\) random vector \(X\) belongs attraction domain \(K\)-block Hüsler-Reiss graphical model, minimum penalised negative loglikelihood conveges almost surely true precision matrix model \(\Theta^*\), \(\lambda\), provided choose sequence \((\zeta_n)_{n\\mathbb N^*}\) grows slower \(log(n)^s\) sequence \(s < 8\).

title: Clusterpath algorithm for Hüsler-Reiss models — hr-clusterpath

what: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
text: penalised negative loglikelihood Hüsler-Reiss graphical models can written follow : $$  L_{\mathcal P}^{(n)}(\Theta, \lambda) = \underbrace{-\log(|\Theta|_+) -  \frac 12 \text{tr}(\hat \Gamma^{(n)}\Theta)}_{L^{(n)}(\Theta)} + \lambda  \underbrace{\sum_{<j} w_{ij} d^2_{ij}(\Theta)}_{\mathcal P(\Theta)} $$ \(|\cdot|_+\) generalised determinant, \(n\) sample size, \(\hat \Gamma^{(n)}\) estimation variogram matrix \(\Gamma\) \(w_{ij}>0\) weights.

title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
code: NegLikelihood_HR(R, clusters, Gamma)  penalty(R, clusters, weights)  NegLikelihood_penalised(R, clusters, Gamma, weights, lambda)

title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
text: weights \(d \times d\) symmetric matrix \(W\) zero diagonal. gamma \(d \times d\) matrix: variogram matrix \(\Gamma\).

title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
text: neg_likelihood(), produces function two parameters : R \(K \times K\) clusters matrix clusters list indices associated partition \(V\) compute value non penalised negative log-likelihood \(L^{(n)}(\Theta)\). penalty(), produces function two parameters : R \(K \times K\) clusters matrix clusters list indices associated partition \(V\) compute value penalty \(\mathcal P(\Theta)\). neg_likelihood_pen(), produces function three parameters : R : \(K \times K\) clusters matrix clusters : list indices associated partition \(V\) lambda : positive number, weight penalty. compute value penalised negative log-likelihood \(L_{\mathcal P}^{(n)}(\Theta, \lambda)\).

title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood
text: use block matrix structure compute likelihood (see build_theta() extract_R_matrix()), use two parameters computation instead one matrix \(\Theta\).

title: Negative log-likelihood for Hüsler-Reiss graphical models — likelihood

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
text: Returns, merging, list new clusters corresponding R matrix, coefficient new clustered computing averaging coefficient two previous clusters.

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) gamma <- matrix(c(0,2,1,0,                   2,0,4,1,                   1,4,0,7,                   0,1,7,0), nc = 4) cost <- neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, weights, 100000) #> Error in neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, weights, 1e+05): unused argument (1e+05) merge_clusters(R, clusters, cost = cost) #> Error in merge_clusters(R, clusters, cost = cost): could not find function "merge_clusters"

text: gamma d x d variogram matrix.

title: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
text: function R matrix clusters compute gradient matrix negative log likelihood fixed variogram gamma. gradient matrix can computed :   : - dlog = t(U) g(Theta_p) U - 0.5 diag(t(U) g(Theta_p) U) - dtrace = - t(U) gamma U  + 0.5 diag(t(U) gamma U)

what: Functions to navigate between \(R\) and \(\Theta\) for given clusters — theta-r
title: Functions to navigate between \(R\) and \(\Theta\) for given clusters — theta-r
text: block matrix models characterized two objects : clustering partition \(\{C_1, \dots, C_K\}\) \(V = \{1, \dots, d\}\) matrix \(R\) belongs \(\mathcal S_K(\mathbb R)\), set symmetric \(K \times K\) matrix. expression precision matrix \(\Theta\) statisfying block matrix assumption $$    \Theta = U R U^t + $$ \(U\) cluster matrix \(\) diagonal matrix rows theta sum zero : \( a_{ii} = - \sum_l p_l r_{kl} \) \(\) cluster \(C_k\).

code: clusters <- list(c(1,2,3), c(4,5)) W <- matrix(1:25, nc = 5) W_c <- weight_clustered(W) #> Error in weight_clustered(W): could not find function "weight_clustered" W_c(clusters) #> Error in W_c(clusters): could not find function "W_c"
